result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas W. Polzin

records.addlTxt: Faxed amended bond to Eau Claire County Jail

The defendant shall have no contact with A.W.P. or H.S.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.
AMENDED 10/14/2022 from a $1500.00 cash bond to a $1000.00 cash bond, same conditions

8:28 AM Defendant Douglas W. Polzin appeared by video. from Eau Claire County Jail   Attorney Christine Kuczynski appeared by video for Douglas W. Polzin.  Attorney Melissa Inlow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.    Asking to have cash bond to a high signature bond.  State is in compliance with Victim Rights Law. State objects.  Court will reduce to a $1000.00 cash bond, same conditions
Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/Bond Review on October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
